New Records: KL Rahul's hundred came off merely 62 balls, the fastest World Cup century by an India batter
Shreyas Iyer and KL Rahul added 208 runs in 128 balls for the fifth wicket, both ending with centuries of their own
Key Match Events: Virat Kohli accounted for Scott Edwards with the ball, for just his fifth ODI wicket
Rohit Sharma brought in Virat Kohli to rest his mainstream bowlers and Kohli managed to strike with the ball
Kuldeep Yadav struck off his very first ball and proved an equally tough proposition for the Dutch batters
Ravindra Jadeja struck off his very first ball and proved an equally tough proposition for the Dutch batters
Shreyas Iyer and KL Rahul opened their arms in the death and picked up the scoring rate even further
Iyer reached his maiden Cricket World Cup ton in the 46th over
Rahul reached a century of his own on the back of consecutive sixes in the 50th over
Pre-Game Insights: Rohit Sharma won the toss and elected to bat first
Both sides were unchanged ahead of the final group clash in the Cricket World Cup
Post-Match Reflections: India win their ninth successive contest in CWC23
The Netherlands put up a spirited display with the bat, but never quite came close to overhauling the mammoth target of 411 that had been set by India
Miscellaneous Highlights: India were helped to their highest score of the tournament by their batters before the bowlers did a clinical job in the second innings
India's top five batters all scored in excess of fifty, with Shreyas Iyer and KL Rahul going on to garner centuries
Rohit's 61 came off 54 balls. It included eight fours and two sixes
Shubman Gill hit four sixes during his fifty
Bas de Leede became the most successful Dutch bowler in the Cricket World Cup with 15 scalps to his name, overtaking his father, Tim de Leede
